jobDescription: Wolters Kluwer (www.wolterskluwer.com) is a global leader in professional information services. Professionals in the areas of legal, business, tax, accounting, finance, audit, risk, compliance and healthcare rely on Wolters Kluwer's market leading information-enabled tools and software solutions to manage their business efficiently, deliver results to their clients, and succeed in an ever more dynamic world. Wolters Kluwer combines deep domain knowledge with specialized technology. Our portfolio offers software tools coupled with content and services that customers need to make decisions with confidence. Every day, our customers make critical decisions to help save lives, improve the way we do business, build better judicial and regulatory systems. We help them get it right. advanced proficiency in MS Excel and MS Access including formulas, pivot tables, charts, macros, queries, and data collection/importExperience with advanced analysis (e.g. predictive) and familiarity with statistical packagesExperience using Workday and participation in an HCM implementation with a large, global organization preferredFamiliarity with business informatics and intelligence tools, such as Tableau and Business Objects preferredFlexibility to travel if required (minimal) Wolters Kluwer N.V. (AEX: WKL) is a global leader in information services and solutions for professionals in the health, tax and accounting, risk and compliance, finance and legal sectors.
